inn1.comm: 131kmph, on the middle and leg, veers in towards the hips, tucked towards square-leg
full, in the zone outside the offstump, left alone
full on a length, straight on the off and middle stump line, defended to cover region
Huge shout for lbw! Close. Landed on a length, around offstump line, moved in and trapped him in front of middle and leg. The only concern is height but geez.... that looked real close.
way outside the offstump and Sri Lanka are off with the help of a wide
fullish, outside the offstump, driven to mid-off
145kmph. Very good delivery. Lands on a length, around the offstump line, moves away and Jayasuriya is beaten going for a drive. Swing and seam movement there
on the hips, tries to work it away to the leg side, it runs away off the pads
146kmph. Pace and bounce. Landed on a length, around middle and off, kicked up and Tharanga adjusted to extra bounce, taps it in front of him
on the hips, bounces again, dabbed to square-leg bye.
defended off the back foot , to the cover region
First runs off the bat. Slightly short of length, around the offstump line, Jayasuriya hops back and cuts it down to thirdman region
Wide called but it went off the thigh pad, down to the 'keeper. Hmm... maybe umpire Baxter is still caught up in the emotional farewells to the three Australian players and is bit teary....!
Tharanga gets his first runs. Four. In style. Fullish, on the off and he drilled it through extra cover
short of length, around offstump, punched to extra cover

Slightly short of length, on the hips, Jayasuriya swivels to pull it behind square-leg. Doesn't throw the kitchen sink at it, just throws the utensils into the sink. Or something like that. You get the idea right? Not a ferocious pull, but just helping it along.
Down the leg side, can't get the bat on it
beaten! full on a length, lands around offstump line, moves away and Tharanga goes fishing, hunting and returns empty handed. Lucky I would say... as he could have only nicked it to slip cordon
full outside off, left alone
outside off, dabbed away to thirdman region
yorker! Right up there, around the middle stump line, dug out by Jayasuriya

Twhack! Super pull shot! No fiddling around this time, he lifted his right leg in the air, balancing on the back leg as he pushed his weight back and spank it over square-leg. One bounce into the boundary.
full and angling away outside the offstump, left alone
on the hips, tucked to square-leg region
on the hips again, helped along to fineleg
131kmph, lands on a length, on the middle and leg stump line, comes back in a touch and Jayasuriya is rapped on the pad as he pushes forward in defense. Very high
full in length, on the middle and leg, pushed away to right of square-leg
inside-edge to fineleg and Tharanga will retain the strike

150kmph! full and furious, on the leg and middle stump line, moved towards middle, late swing, and Tharanga is squared-up as he shapes to play it to the on side. Gets a leading edge and it runs past cover.
Whack! Too full, around the offstump line, Jayasuriya plays a delectable slice shot over cover. Down came the bat, inside the line, and he carved it up, scooped it up over cover.
Down the leg side.
149 kmph, full and fast, on the offstump line, Jayasuriya leans forward, opens the bat-face, steers it to left of point.
151kmph, on the hips, straying a touch here, in this over, tucked behind square-leg
Huge shout for lbw. 150 kmph! Lands outside the legstump though. And it spears in towards the pads and Jayasuriya is beaten for pace.
Another shout for lbw! Inside-edge this time. Full and fast, on the middle and offstump line, Jayasuriya tries to drive, gets a thick inside-edge onto his back pad.
defended to the offside
banged in short, it rises chest-high, on top of the offstump, Tharanga not only sways away but also goes down on his knee
beaten! 134 kmph lands on a length, around middle and offstump line, moves away and Tharanga gets his bat down the wrong line, outside the line, and is beaten
full and on the legs, tries to tickle it around the corner, it bounds off his pads to right of McCullum who makes a smart acrobatic stop
This time Ross Taylor goes diving. Lovely drive from Tharanga and Taylor threw himself to his right at cover to make a very good stop. Would have been four, otherwise
on the leg and middle, bounces up, on the hips, Jayasuriya hops back, tries to turn it to the on side, is beaten for pace and is struck on the thigh pad
on the middle and leg, worked to right of square-leg
150kmph, full and on the leg and middle stump line, hint of inswing, turned past square-leg. The only cricticism so far, about Bond today, is that he is a bit on the legstump line.
Bouncer! on the top of the middle stump line, ducked under
143kmph, pushed across Tharanga, who lets that one sail through to the 'keeper
full and right up there on the middle stump line, pushed out towards cover, Tharanga sets off for a run, Jayasuriya doesn't understand all that fuss, sends him back and he makes it in time.
another one almost at the block hole, around middle and off, pushed to point
Bosh! Overpitched around the offstump line, Jayasuriya drills it right down the ground. Take that!
oh ho! Jayasuriya charges down the track, Mason digs it in short, Jayasuriya adjusts and swats it over cover.
bouncer , outside offstump, left alone
Slap! Full and wide outside offstump, Jayasuriya thrusts his right foot out, leans across and spanks it over point. Super shot. The ball just flew to the point boundary
hits the deck short of length, it rises up almost chest-high, pushed to the square of the wicket
defended to the offside
146kmph, on the leg and middle stump line, on a length, defended back down the track
short of length, around offstump line, defended to the offside
banged in short, slipping down the offside, left alone
Super shot! 143kmph delivery, short of length, around offstump line, Tharanga forces it off the backfoot, past point. Hit on the up.
on the middle and leg stump line, pushed to the on side
lands outside legstump, pushes forward in defense, and appeal for a lbw but it will be an extra
bouncer, on the legstump line, too high.
Wow! What a shot! Short of length, on the middle stump line, Jayasuriya short-arm-jabs it over mid-on. It ends up over long on!
The white ball is flying everywhere. This one is swung over deep midwicket. He just leant forward and non-chalantly swung it over the cow corner. This man is pure entertainment.

He is box office! Hat trick six! This one pulled over long leg. The arc from long-on to square-leg has been pinged. First one flew over long-on, next went screaming over midwicket and this one was deposited over deep square-leg. What a player!
fullish, on the leg and middle, Jayasuriya attempts to whack this one as well, ends up dragging it behind square-leg. Will retain strike!

Would you believe it?  Fourth six in five balls. This one screams over deep backward squareleg. Where did the ball land? Outside the offstump. He leans forward, fetches it from there, with a flick of a wrist and just creams it up and over.

Appeal for lbw, there was a inside nick and that should have been his fifty but the umpire doesn't spot the edge and gives it a leg bye. It was around legstump... and Jayasuriya tries to whack it across the line
another legbye, gets Jayasuriya, on 49, on strike
Disappointment. Just a four! Brings up his fifty in style. Short of length, on the offstump line, and Jayasuriya pulls it.
Another one slightly short of lenght, Jayasuriya attempts to cut, inside edge and the ball rolls away

starts off with a fullish delivery, around offstump line, driven to cover, Jayasuriya almost backs up too far, Patel has a throw from cover, misses, Jayasuriya was home. Jayasuriya goes across to Tharanga to have a chat. did he say, 'Give the strike to me!' ?!
Fullm outside offstump, Tharanga tries to slog it away, the bat comes down in an angle, inside edge takes it to fineleg region and Jayasuriya pushes his young partner and they come back for three
Well well well..... this man is on fire! This is fun. Full on a length, around the offstump, Jayasuriya just leans forward, swings it over widish long-on. Up and up she goes and over the ropes.
Thrash! Length-delivery, outside the offstump and in a blink the ball crashes into the cover fence. Just slapped through the offside field. Imperious.
This one is deposited to deep backward square-leg boundary. Just leans forward, swings it across the line, with that wondeful flick of the wrist.
Tharanga pushes it towards mid-off and rushes off for a single. Jayasuriya is on strike now

Don't believe me, I am not lying, this is just a dot ball. I know.... tough to believe but thats that! He tries to pull a slightly short of length, on the middle and offstump line, can't beat the man on the on side.
Blasphemy. A forward defense this time.
hattrick dot balls! Good stuff from Gillespie. Keeps the slasher quiet with a length delivery on the middle stump line, pushed back down the track
Bouncer this time! Good one. Ducked under.
on the middle and leg, tucked behind square-leg. Good over comes to an end.
from round the stumps, fullish, on middle and leg, tapped to right of midwicket. Gets a single. 100 up for SL in the 15th over.
on the offstump line, turns away slightly, pushed to point
low full-toss on the legs, dabbed away to deep square-leg. Another single.
leans forward to a ball on the middle stump line, defends
fullish, on the middle stump line, pushed to the offside
driven to short cover. Good tight over from Patel

The carnage comes to an end. Jayasuriya leaves the slaughter house. He attempts to pull a short of length delivery, ends up top-edging it to fine-leg. End of the entertainment. New Zealand won't be complaining though. What a knock. RIpper of a knock. he just walloped them everywhere.

Gillespie is on fire. Another strike! Full in length, on the middle stump line, held its line, Tharanga is late in leaning forward, just pushes down the wrong line, the ball thuds into the thigh pad and knocks back the furniture.
length-delivery on the stumps, turned to the on side
lands on a length, around off and middle stump line, Atapattu stands up tall, left-elbow high and defends it to the offside
leans forward, nudges a length-delivery to cover
142kmph bouncer, outside the offstump line, Atapattu drops his wrists, gets his bat away from the line, lets it fly past him
spears in full and fast, 142 kmph, on the offstump line, comes in with the angle. defended off the front foot. Two maidens in a row
What a shot! Just a punch off the back foot and it races away. Short of length, on the middle stump line, Sanga stands tall, punches it and bisects the bowler and the mid-on. Superb piece of timing
in the zone outside offstump, left alone
on a length, around the offstump line, comes in with the angle, punched to cover.
scrambled seam, spears in on the hips, tucked behind square for two runs
Outside the offstump, left alone
Just outside the offstump, he gets back and across, nudges it towards point
defended off the back foot.
short of length, on the offstump line, pushed to cover
back of length, on the middle stump line, turned to the on side
fuller, on a length, just outside the offstump, leans forward, works it towards point
from slightly wide of the crease, short of length, outside the offstump, Atapattu stands tall, pushes it out to the offside
Slower one, delivered from back of the hand, ends up as a full toss above waist high, dabbed away to the on side
on a length, defended to the offside
lands on a length, in the channel outside offstump, drives to Fulton at cover
slight short of length, outside the offstump line, Sangakkara goes back and across, lets it go through to the 'keeper
And again. This time Sanga leans forward, shoulders arms
short of length, outside offstump line, punched to cover
this time punched to mid-on. Both Gillespie and Adams are bowling a tight line and keeping things quiet. Good comeback after that manic start by Jayasuriya
again short of length, outside the offstump, comes in with the angle, punched to point
lands on a length, outside the offstump, comes in a touch, pushed out to covers
full on a length, around offstump line, defended away to the offside
on the middle stump line, worked towards midwicket
banged it short, on the hips, Sangakkara tries to pull it and is beaten by the lack of bounce there and it runs away off the thighs, to the fine-leg region
slants away well outside offstump, Sangakkara goes for a cut, misses
turned away to square-leg
on the offstump line, pushed to the offside
on the middle and leg, defended away
on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket region for a single
lands on a length, around middle and leg, turned to square-leg
lands on a length, around the offstump line, moves away a touch, punched to cover
full on a length, around offstump line, defended to the on side
on the offstump line, Sangakkara uses his wrists, works it past square-leg
length-delivery on the off and middle stump line, defended off the front foot
slightly short of length, outside the offstump line, Atapattu goes for a cut shot, doesn't time it well and it rolls away to point
almost played on! Short of length, pitches outside the offstump, Atapattu tries to force it on the up and gets a insideedge.
from round the stumps, on the offstump line, dabbed away to midwicket, there is a misfield and they will scamper through
full on a length, around the offstump line, leans forward, opens the bat-face, runs it to point
short of length, around the offstump, Atapattu leans back, punches it through the line and diving stop by Fulton at cover.
back to round the stumps for Sanga. On the off and middle, back of length, worked behind square-leg
slightly short of length, outside the offstump, Atapattu shifts his weight to his backfoot, punches it straight to point
fuller, on a length, on the offstump line, Atapattu respects the line and the length and defends. It has been pretty slow going after Jayasuriya's fall as Sri Lanka try to re build
on the middle and leg, worked past square-leg.
from wide of the crease, comes in from outside off, turned to the on side
short of length, on the off and middle stump line, defended away to the onside
lands on a length, from outside the offstump line, pushed to cover
fuller, driven out to mid-off. The stranglehold continues.
pushed across Sangakkara, who shoulders arms
lands on the offstump line, turns in , dabbed away, with the spin, to square-leg
lands outside offstump, turns a bit, tapped to backward point
flighted, fuller, on the offstump line, he leans forward, pushes it out past cover
tossed up, outside offstump line, Atapattu comes down the track, pats it to mid-off
full and on the middle and leg, tries to work it around the corner, runs off the pads
Atapattu charges out and biffs it down the ground and the Mason, at long-off, couldn't cut that lofted shot. A boundary after a very long time.
full and on the offstump line, turned past midwicket
again on that middle and legstump line, tapped towards square-leg
slower one. on the offstump line, he waits for it, drives through cover point
yorker, dug out towards midon
on the middle and leg, defended off the front foot
beaten! Outside the offstump, full in length, and it goes straight on, Atapattu plays for spin, it isn't there and is beaten
short, outside the offstump, Atapattu goes back and across, opens up and pulls but the timing is awry, and the ball rolls towards midwicket
on the legs, flicked fine for a boundary.  Augustus... Atapattu has got your message.
single down to the leg side. The runs are starting to come now
on the middle and leg, tickled to right of short fine leg where Fleming gets across to make the stop
outside the offstump, edged past short thirdman, and they come back quickly for a second run to beat the throw from Bond
bouncer, over the top of middle and offstump line, Sanga sways away in time
back to that middle and leg stump line, Bond has been pinging that line to the left-hand batsmen, turned to squareleg

hits the deck short of length, strays on to the hips, tucked away to fineleg. With Mark Gillespie off, Sri Lanka are slowly breaking free of the shackles. They had to be careful once they lost a few wickets in a hurry, had to rebuild and now are looking to press on
fullish, driven to mid-on
full, right up there, at middlestump line, driven back to Bond, who stretches his right hand, plucks the ball and threatens to throw it back at the stumps.
short, it rises chest-high, Sangakkara pulls it down the ground, out to long leg
fuller, outside off, Atapattu drives, but goes too hard at it, the bat-handle rotates in his hands and the ball rolls over to the offside.
flighted on the middle and leg, driven to mid-on
spins in from outside off, Atapattu goes back, backs away a touch, taps it in front of point and will get a single
beaten! quicker and it spins past Sangakkara's defensive blade. McCullum doesn't gather it cleanly
defended off the front foot
on the legs, nudged past square-leg
spins in from outside off, Atapattu goes back, waits for the turn, and then works it past square-leg
short of length, outside off, swatted away to cover
fuller, outside off, drives but straight to cover
full on a length, around offstump line, leans forward and defends.
fullish, outside offstump and again Atapattu can't pierce the field, drives straight to cover.
Again no luck. Short of length, outside off, he cuts but straight to point. Atapattu is struggling to pick the gaps.
lands on a length, around offstump line, shapes in, Atapattu leans forward to defend, the ball evades the bat and thuds into thigh. Drinks break.
tossed up, driven to long-off
tapped to extra cover region and they rush across for a single
flighted on the middle and leg stump line, driven to long-on
flighted delivery, on off and middle, Atapattu comes down the track, turns it to midwicket. Taylor makes a smart sliding stop
on the middle and leg, lapped behind square-leg
lands on a length, on the offstump line, turned past square-leg
fullish, outside off, pushed to cover and set off for a single. Taylor rushes across to his right, and has a shy at the striker's end, misses but Atapattu was home
on the middle and leg, turned behind square-leg
on a length, straight on the middle and off, Sangakkar stays back, turns it to the on side
on the middle and leg, worked past square-leg
defended off the back foot.
outside offstump, dabbed away behind point.
comes down the track, chipped  towards long-on
worked to midwicket for a single
outside offstump, plays it square of the wicket for a single
overpitched outside off, driven to deep cover
again full, worked to midwicket region
outside offstump, run down to thirdman region
strays on to the legs, glanced down to fine leg
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
full on the stumps, driven to extra cover
fullish, on the middle stump line, driven to long on

Action! Lands on a length, outside off, came back in a touch, Atapattu almost drags it back on to the stumps, the ball rolls past legstump. McMillan whips off the bails, but Atapattu puts his feet into the crease, in time
fullish, driven to longoff
outside offstump, full in length, carved past point
Very skilful shot. Short of length, outside offstump, Sangakkara let it come to him, played it late and guided it behind point and squarish thirdman.
full on a length, runs down to backward point
on the legs, flicked away behind square
on a length, outside the offstump, guided to backward point to Marshall
this time he moves close to the line of the ball, dabs it down to thirdman region
appeal for a caught behind dismissal. Short of length, outside the offstump, Sangakkara shapes to pull and the ball goes below the blade. There was a noise, must have brushed the back thigh
bang! Full and on the offstump line, Sangakkar goes down on a bent-knee and sweeps it in front of square. Sweep shot to a mediumpacer. The pitch must be good.
worked straight to Fleming at midwicket
full and on the middle stump line, Sangakkara punches it to left of McMillan who dives and parries it away to midwicket
around the offstump line, driven to cover
on the legs, turned past square-leg
The charge! Sangakkar leaps out of the crease, Mason bowls a slower one, he adjusts and drills it past mid-on
under-edge over the stumps. Attempts to cut, ends up chopping it over the stumps
fullish, slower full-toss, driven back to the bowler
lands outside leg, moves in, Sangakkara shuffles across, tries to tickle it across the line, misses and is rapped on the pads. Mason appeals, even as he rushes across to the offside to pick the ball,
Mason ends his spell with bouncer, down the legside.
on the middle stump line, turned away to backward squareleg
fullish, driven to long-off
flighted up, outside offstump, Atapattu comes down the track, drives towards midoff
on the middle stump line, swept away past square
tossed up, outside off, Sangakkara drives, in the air, through mid-off to long-off. That's his fifty. Patient knock as he tried to rebuild after that triple strike from Gillespie
Sangakkar backs away, drives a fullish delivery, on the middle stump line, to covers
full on a length, biffed, across the line, through mid-on
Got him! Atapattu is a goner. He charges down the track, backing away in the process, and throws his bat at a length delivery but only suceeds in getting a nick behind. Simple catch.
fullish, on the middle stump line, worked past midwicket
on the offstump line, driven back to the bowler. Didn't  time that one properly
fullish, driven to long-on
slips down the legside, Sanga tries to lap it around the corner, misses
Patel keeps him quiet. again. on the offstump line, drives but back to the bowler. Again mis-timed.
dropped chance by the bowler himself. Full-toss and Sanga swats it straight back, above head-high and Patel ends up palming it away.
floated up around off, lofts it over the bowler
driven to long-on
outside offstump, full in length, driven to deep cover
on the middle stump line, pushed past square-leg
Great shot! He leant forward, drove inside-out, over wide mid-off. Very deliberatel, very skillful and very well placed.
short of length, punched past cover
on the middle stump line, pushed to cover, no chance for a run
beaten! In the zone outside off, on a length, he tries to dab it away with an open bat-face, misses.
yorker length, on the middle stump line, jabbed away past point. Very well bowled.
floated on the offside, driven, in the air, back down the track but it falls short of the bowler. Sangakkara dives back to make his crease, just in case Patel decides to fling back a throw
comes down the track, Patel pings the yorker-length again, dug out past point. This is intelligent bowling. He went wide of the crease and hurled it across at the blockhole length
too shot, pulled straight to midwicket.  He should have put that away,.

innovation! Sangakkar just shuffles right across the stumps, ends up outside offstump, picks a fullish delivery from there, and laps it over short fineleg. Aha! here we go.. the final five overs and time for some fun

Slap! Short and wide, Sangakkar thrashes it over point. Two fours in a row. Oh hold on ... six given but the ball landed on the ropes, and that should be given as a four. Not six but the umpire has given it the maximum
Wham! Full this time and Sangakkara drills it powerfully to deep point. There is a man there but he is not able to move across to his right in time to make the stop. Such was the power.
again full, again drilled to deep point but this time straight to the fielder
Gillespie, famous for his bowling at death, hurls in  yorker, jabbed away to the on side
again fullish length, dabbed away to thirdman
Sangakkara again tries to walk across the offstump and lap it around the corner but doesn't make proper contact . In fact no contact and it runs off the leg bye
another near blockhole -length delivery, dug back to the bowler
full in length, driven to long-on

Again Sangakkar goes across to the offside, Gillespie tries a yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, turned straight to Bond at short fine leg. A foot either side of the former cop and Sanga would have got a boundary

Sangakkar falls. Quite a big wicket this. Just three overs left but he was in a murderous mood. He goes for a pull shot but ends up skying it to midwicket for Taylor to hold a dolly. Very valuable knock, steered his side through the crisis.
fullish, outside offstump, driven to mid-off
Slower one! beaten comprehensively. Maharoof is through his shot a light year before the ball arrives
fullish, sliced past backward point, Mason rushes across to make a very good diving, tumbling, sliding stop
The slower one doesn't work this time. Maharoof backs away, waits for the loopy delivery to come to him and then murders it down the ground
yorker, jabbed away to the offside , it rolls away towards Taylor
The white ball flies over long-on! Fullish, Maharoof, takes his front foot outside the line, gets under the ball and up she flies.. Maximum!
Good comeback. yorker, right there at the middle stump line, stabbed away for a single
And again. Good delivery

Maharoof lets it rip again! From wide of  the crease, it didn't quite come out as a yorker, lands on a length, and Maharoof opens up in his stance, and just biffs it over long leg. Super whack! Disappointing end to what has been a very good day out for Gillespie
attempts a yorker, drives to long on. Maharoof back on strike
slightly slower in pace, on a length, outside the offstump, Maharoof had backed outside legstump, tries to swing it across but is beaten by the change in pace

Gone! banged it short and outside offstump, Maharoof swatted it, like a down the line forehand, in the air, and down the ground, Adams moves to his right, and takes a smart catch. The neat little cameo comes to an end
Now Vaas joins in the slog fun. Moves to the on side, biffs a low full-toss to the cow corner.
banged it in short, slogged away to the leg side but no timing there and will get a single to the midwicket region.

inn2.comm: landed on a length, on the middle and offstump line, McCullum turns it to midwicket
Just outside the offstump, run down to the thirdman. That typical ODI shot. Open the bat-face a touch, and dab it down
on a length, outside the offstump line, jabbed away to the offside
short of length, outside offstump, pushed to point
outside the offstump line, left alone
short of length, 147kmph, bounces up, pushed to the offside. What a slingy action this bloke has. So difficult to pick and we saw a few NZ batsmen in the Test series completely lose sight of the ball
short of length, on the offstump line, punched to mid-off
149kmph, short of length, outside off, cut to point where Kapugedera makes a neat stop
148 kmph, on a length, on the off and middle , worked to the on side. Malinga is right on target here
146kmph, on the off and middle stump line, defended off the front foot
Super cut! up and over point. Shortish, leaps up outside offstump, McCullum went back and across and cut it over the in field.
Gone! Vaas nails Fleming! Landed on a length, around middle stump, moved in and Fleming was beaten on the forward prod. It was probably brushing the legstump. Umpire Baxter definitely thinks so.
in the zone outside the offstump line, left alone
133kmph again in that probing line outside offstump, he pushes at it and withdraws his bat just at the last minute. Unsure of whether it would come in or go out.
Beaten again! Taylor is uncertain, anticipating that delivery which Vaas brings back in, and pushes out at the one which leaves him again.
Agony for Vaas. Deja-vu for the batsman, oohs and aahs from behind the wicket. Again it shapes away after landing on a length around middle and off, again Taylor pokes at it and is beaten
Sliced over point! Full and wide, Thank you says McCullum and slashes it over point
defended on the back foot
Another one disappears. This time down to fineleg. Poor delivery, sprays on the legside, glanced fine. The new year gift.
Another boundary gift-wrapped. The festive season is on. On the hips, clipped past squareleg

Super catch from Sangakkara! Maharoof realises the new year has long dawned and hustles McCullum with a good-length delivery that jags back in and cuts McCullum into half. McCullum stabs at it and it goes off the inside edge and goes to left of the keeper. A great acrobatic effort from Sangakkara does the trick. Super delivery that. Wonderful nip-backer.
on a length, around the offstump line, pushed to the offside

Taylor is stitched up by Vaas. After harassing him with deliveries angling away, he brings this one back in. Taylor is surprised,  and is caught at the crease, the ball thuds into the pad, right in front of the middle stump. Dead duck! Sri Lanka are running hot here. That 263 looks a long distance away
around the offstump line, pushed to the offside
short of length, lands a touch outside leg and moves in towards middle, pushed to on side
Another one whistling through the corridor of uncertainity. left alone. 3 overs, 2 maidens, 1 run and 2 wickets.
on the middle and leg, worked towards right of mid-on
fullish, outside the offstump, driven inside out to cover
fullish, just outside the offstump, offdrives but gets an inside edge and runs to long-leg
swing and a miss! Short of length, outside offstump, it holds its line, he tries to force it through offside ring, misses
on a length, outside the offstump, punched to cover
spearing in on the pads, flicked, from front of his pads, behind square-leg
short of length, around the offstump line, defended away to the offside
full and angling away, inviting a drive, left alone
slightly short of length, just outside the offstump, punched to point

Another one bites the dust! And then there were six. Again Vaas brings one back in, after a taking out few deliveries, and the champion bowler goes up in screeching appeal and ends up with a smile. Marshall had got his front feet too much across, tries to play around it and is trapped in front.
length delivery, outside offstump, McMillan steers it to gully
slightly short of length, outside the offstump, dabbed away to thirdman. McMillan, finding his way back into international cricket, is up and away
banged it in short of length, in the corridor outside the offstump, left alone
McMillan goes for a wild swing and is beaten. Trying to counterattack. Full and outside off, he trid to send it Christchurch and is beaten.
Lands on a length, jags back in, McMillan stabs at it, gets a inside edge back on to his pads
fullish, driven to cover
just outside the offstump, short of length, steered to backward point

Run out chance missed! McMillan would have been a goner if the throw had hit. He pushed a short of length delivery to cover region and sets off. Kapugedera swoops in, shys at the non-striker's end and misses narrowly.
135 kmph, lands outside the leg stump, moves in, McMillan falls over a touch while trying to work it to the on side, and is rapped on the pads.
fuller, around the offstump line, angles away, McMillan pushes at it, and it runs towards backward point off a thick outside edge
in the channel outside the offstump, slanting away, left alone
full on a length, just outside the offstump, McMillan leans forward, head over the ball, defends
135 kmph, on the offstump line, full in length, driven to mid-off
again on a similar line, McMillan is crouching a bit more than what I seem to recall of his batting before, gets his head right over the ball, pushes it out to the offside
slips down the legside. Good diving take by Sangakkara
beaten outside offstump

huge shout for lbw, Just struck outside the offstump and he was trying to play. He leant forward to a length-delivery, that came in after pitching outside offstump and ends up pushing outside the line.
Good shot. Well outside offstump, short of length, Fulton stands up tall and punches it through the line, past cover.
outside the offstump, left alone
defended off the front foot
keeps teasing outside offstump, McMillan has looked pretty solid so far, leans forward to push it to cover. Vaas will get one ball in and thats the one McMillan has to watch out for.
full and wide, slashed away powerfully but straight to point
offcutter on the offstump line, he leans forward, adjusts to the movement by opening the bat-face, runs it down to backward point
Edge! but falls short of a diving Jayawardene at widish first slip. Again slanting away, McMillan pushes hard at it, and Jayawardene dives to his right but it had fallen well short of him.
Good response from McMillan. Shortish, and little bit of width outside off, McMillan moved towards the line and forced it past point
Now the perfect forward defensive stroke

Strikes rightaway! Beaten for pace! Full on a length, outside the offstump, comes back in, Fulton is driving down the wrong lane and the ball thuds into his pad, in front of the offstump, and he is a goner. Five down for 37 and New Zealand are limping here at Auckland.
Neither of us are right. It is short of length, on the middle and leg stump, pushed to the on side
Hello?! A bouncer, screaming past the face of Adams, who sways away quickly.
slings a fullish one, attempted yorker, ends up spearing it outside the offstump, left alone. Sangakkara has a huge smile as he gathers
Bumper! on the left shoulder, Adams ducks
141 kmph and guess what, another bouncer. Ducked under. The crowd boo....!

Vaas gets the ball to bend back in, McMillan gets his bat down in time, actually the bat hits the pad as it comes down, the bat-face, which was shut, opens out after that impact and sends the ball to the on side. Good delivery.
Another shout for lbw! but going over. Only just. McMillan leans forward, falls over a touch as the ball bends back in and is rapped right in front but it was going over.
oh ho! McMillan, in an attempt to throw Vaas off his length, charges at him, has a swing but misses.
fuller, on the middle and leg, turned past square-leg.
slightly short of length, around the offstump, he tries to force it on the up, the ball bounds away to right of Fernando at mid-on
back of length, slanting away, pushed to the cover region

Ouch! Fast and furious, swung in late and crashed into the left boot of Adams. He is hobbling in pain and to his horror, he has been given out lbw. The first bad decision of the innings. It was going to miss the legstump. definitely. Now Adams has to limp his way back into the hutch. He would need some treatment for that hit to his feet.

Surprise Surprise, a 149kmph yorker, right on the middle stump line, stabbed away. 15,000 in the crowd groan aloud.  They don't want their strike bowler being hit by a yorker. Malinga is slinging fire here.
outside the offstump, fullish, left alone
141kmph snorter, kicks up from just short of length, Bond fends at it, and the ball crashes into his glove and runs away to fine-leg
Another bouncer, left alone, McMillan, as said earlier, is crouching at the crease, and as soon as he sees the length, he ducks further, and avoids it easily. Interesting technique.
Another bouncer and dealt with it similarily

Just about carried to a diving Jayawardene, at first slip, but he couldn't quite pull it off. Very very difficult chance. Bond pushed at a delivery slanting across him and gets an outside edge and Jayawaredene, standing at widish slip, dives to his left, gets his left hand out, almost under the ball but can't quite clasp it
short of length, pushed to the offside
fullish, driven to mid-off
again full, outside off, McMillan leans forward drives to left of Maharoof at mid-off
he leans forward, defends. Drinks break. New Zealand would need it, Malinga would get time to recharge and we should have lots more action at the other side of the break

Malinga cons the ex cop. With a slower one. Bond is completely deceived, ends up playing too early, across the line, and the leading edge is swallowed up by a delighted Malinga. And then there were three. And er... Muralitharan is yet to bowl.
Full and straight on the middle, Gillespie backs outside legstump, good move to protect the feet, digs it out to the offside
And again. Simple technique, stand outside leg, move away touch, get the bat down, make contact. Simple. Or is it?
What do you do when its a bouncer jack?! Easy Sherlock. Again, stand outside leg, and once you see it has been dug in short, just sway away futher.
Now Fernando joins in the bumper barrage. On the left shoulder, ducked under
McMillan breaks free. Fullish delivery, outside the offstump, and drilled through the covers.
short of length, around offstump, steered to backward point
fuller, on a length, around offstump line, defended away on the front foot
on the hips, McMillan stands tall, tucks it behind square-leg

Fernando doesn't want to be left behind. And he gets rid of Gillespie. Again Gillespie stands outside leg, shuffles away even futher, and pushes at a length-delivery on the offstump line. Edge and taken. New Zealand are in the danger of being shot out for their lowest score. Only McMillan can save them from that embarrasment, but will he be stranded?
Almost trapped. Inside-edge saves him. Full and fast, on the middle and offstump, he pushes at it, gets an inside-edge on to his pads
7 more to go past that lowest score. Full and wide, creamed past cover.
full and fast, on the offstump line, driven to Maharoof at mid-off, misfield there but doesn't cost a run
outside the offstump, left alone
bouncer to keep McMillan scoreless and now Fernando will have a go at Jeetan
beaten outside off. Holds its line after landing on a length outside off.
short of length, around the offstump, pushed to cover
banged in short but well outside the offstump, left alone
Full and on the middle stump line, turned to on side
full again, outside the offstump, driven to cover. Jeetan Patel is concentrating furiously out there.
Edge and it falls just short of second slip! back of length delivery, around the offstump, and it holds its line, Patel pushes at it, inside the line, gets an edge
full, fast, right on the middlestump line, delivered from that roundarm action, McMillan, crouches, pushes at it to deep cover. Refuses to take a single. Wants the strike.

Would you believe it? Fernando, at thirdman, drops a dolly. Malinga slings it in short, McMillan ducks, his bat held high, the ball doesn't bounce as much as he expected, crashes into the periscope and lobs up to thirdman. Fernando rushes it and clangs it! He doesn' t take the single again
defended off the back foot
Bouncer! ducked under. Malinga's bouncers are all very well-directed
And again.

Almost caught. Snorter, rises up like a beast at the throat of McMillan who offers his bat as a face shield, the ball pops up on the leg side, Malinga rushes across but can't reach it. This is another You Tube over from Malinga.
From round the stumps, tossed up, it dips in front of middle, pushed to the on side
doosra, on the offstump line, Patel is beaten , but pushes out... and the ball rolls away towards point
dipping fulltoss on the middle, swept to long leg
goes for a sweep, misses and there is an appeal for lbw but it was turning down legside
The scores are level. ie New Zealand have equalled their previous lowest score. Patel leans forward, swing a tossed up delivery, over mid-on, one bounce over the ropes.
defended off the front foot movement
short of length, outside offstump, pushed to the point.
McMillan takes them past their lowest score. Humiliation avoided but embarassment still looms large. Short of length, punched past point
full and straight, on the middle stump, worked to midwicket region
full and on the legs, McMillan accepts the gift, tickles it around the corner
full and straight on the off and middle, pushed to cover
again, steered to point
short of length, it rises above waist-high... towards point
short, pushed back to the bowler

Murali joins in the carnage. Big offbreak, lands well outside the offstump, short in length, Patel sees the line and the length and shapes to cut. Mistake. The ball rips in and keeps a touch low, and thuds into the middle stump.
on the middle and leg, padded away
rips across a flattish and quickish offbreak on the offstump line, Mason drives, is beaten and it bobs away off the pads
from round the stumps for this delivery, on the middle stump line, swept away for a single. Mason will retain the strike. Hmm...
146 kmph, full delivery on the off and middle, hint of in swing, driven, with a short-back lift, to cover. The crowd cheer!
The left foot doesn't come across at all. Good move. The bat comes down, makes contact and the ball rolls away to cover
Ball hit the bat. Banged in short, Mason recoils, brings his bat across, horizontally, and the ball crashes into the top half of the bat and drops down on the offside
goes for the ribs, swatted away to the on side. Well played

The bails are off. At the non-striker's end though. Nice drive, off a fullish delivery, down the track, Malinga stretches his right hand out, gets a touch and it hits the stumps on the other side. McMillan is inside his crease. No harm done
slower one, but drifts down the legside, and it runs away for a legbye
doosra, on the offstump line, turns away, Mason is beaten trying to sweep

The series is level! Murali traps Mason with a fullish one. New Zealand are shot out for their second lowest score ever. 74 was  that mark and now they have been bundled out, for one run less,  by swing of Vaas, pace of Malinga and the guile of Murali.  It was tossed up, full, on middle and leg stump line, Mason has a swing across the line and is trapped. It would have hit the leg stump. The series is alive and all to play for in the Tuesday's decider.
